Bundesliga
Bayern Munich: leaders give themselves time to replace Kovac
Bayern Munich should take the time to reflect. Uli Hoeness, the president of the Bavarian club, confirmed last night this thesis.
05 Nov 2019, 10:40 by Mourad Bennis



Niko KovacOn post since 2018, Niko Kovac has resigned to its leaders after the heavy disappointment against Frankfurt. Discover the names of his possible successors.Icon Sport



Laurent BlancLibreIcon Sport



Massimiliano Allegri LibreIcon Sport



Ralf RangnickLibreIcon Sport



Jupp HeynckesLibreIcon Sport



Mark Van BommelServing at PSV EindhovenIcon Sport



Ars√®ne WengerLibreIcon Sport



Jos√© MourinhoLibreIcon Sport



Willy SagnolLibreIcon Sport



Julian NagelsmannOffice at LeipzigIcon Sport



Domenico TedescoSitting at Spartak MoscowIcon Sport

Bayern Munich: the tracks to replace Niko Kovac




Last night, Uli Hoeness wants to take his time to study several quality applications. Currently fourth in the Bundesliga after 10 days (four points behind the first, M√∂nchengladbach), Bayern saw a complicated start to the season.

Uli Hoeness wants to think




Uli Hoeness + 11 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

Uli Hoeness said last night at a public evening last night in Munich that the Bavarian club will "think calmly about how to handle this". He added: "I think that by the next match outside of D√ºsseldorf in three weeks we will know how the coach's question has been settled."
Erik Ten Hag, a Dutch coach who is highly regarded by Bayern officials, has assured that he will not leave Ajax this season. There are other attractive tracks: Ars√®ne Wenger, Jos√© Mourinho, Massimiliano Allegri and Ralf Rangnick are available. It is also possible that the coaching position will be returned to Hansi Flick, the current assistant coach who will be acting.
